db:section.db:title: Q_FOREACH(variable, container)
db:section.db:para: This macro is available even when no_keywords is specified using the .pro file's CONFIG variable.

db:note.db:para: Since Qt 5.7, the use of this macro is discouraged. Use C++11 range-based for, possibly with std::as_const(), as needed.

db:section.db:title: Q_FOREVER
db:section.db:para: This macro is available even when no_keywords is specified using the .pro file's CONFIG variable.

db:section.db:title: foreach(variable, container)
db:section.db:para: This macro is used to implement Qt's foreach loop. The variable parameter is a variable name or variable definition; the container parameter is a Qt container whose value type corresponds to the type of the variable. See The foreach Keyword for details.
If you're worried about namespace pollution, you can disable this macro by adding the following line to your .pro file:

db:note.db:para: Since Qt 5.7, the use of this macro is discouraged. Use C++11 range-based for, possibly with std::as_const(), as needed.

db:section.db:title: forever
db:section.db:para: This macro is provided for convenience for writing infinite loops.
If you're worried about namespace pollution, you can disable this macro by adding the following line to your .pro file:
If using other build systems, you can add QT_NO_KEYWORDS to the list of pre-defined macros.
